title: Attacking with Purpose
description: Score goals with smart decisions and teamwork!

questions.question: What should you do if you're in a 2v1 situation?
options: Try to dribble the defender alone
Pass to your teammate if the defender comes to you
questions.explanation: Draw the defender in, then pass to your open teammate.

questions.question: What is the goal of an attacking play?
options: To score or create a chance to score
questions.explanation: Every attack should move toward scoring or threatening the goal.

questions.question: An overlap is when:
options: A teammate runs around you to get ahead
questions.explanation: Overlapping creates confusion for defenders and passing options.

questions.question: When is a good time to dribble instead of pass?
options: When you’re alone and have space
questions.explanation: Use dribbling when there’s space or you can beat a single player.

questions.question: Why is it smart to keep your head up while attacking?
options: To avoid defenders and find teammates
questions.explanation: Good attackers scan for options while moving.

questions.question: A through ball is:
options: A pass into open space behind the defenders
questions.explanation: A through ball helps a teammate run behind the defense to score.

questions.question: What's the best way to break down a tight defense?
options: Pass quickly and move off the ball
questions.explanation: Fast passing and movement pulls defenders out of position.

questions.question: If you’re near the goal with the ball, what do you do?
options: Look to shoot or pass quickly

questions.question: When your teammate is making a run forward, you should:
questions.explanation: Timing and leading passes create scoring chances.

questions.question: What is the benefit of switching the play?
options: It finds space on the other side
It makes it harder to pass
questions.explanation: Switching helps attack open areas when one side is crowded.

questions.question: What helps attackers most when playing as a team?
questions.explanation: Attacking as a group needs movement and smart choices.

questions.question: You are wide open near the goal. What should your teammate do?
questions.explanation: Using open players near goal leads to better chances.

questions.question: When attacking, where is the most dangerous space to go?
options: The middle in front of the goal
questions.explanation: The middle near the goal is the best area to create chances.

questions.question: If you're outnumbered on attack, what should you do?
options: Hold the ball and wait for support
questions.explanation: Slow down and keep possession until teammates arrive.

questions.question: Why should you try to attack fast after winning the ball?
options: The other team is out of position
questions.explanation: Quick attacks can surprise a team that just lost the ball.
